creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center in 2000 in honor of Dr. and Mrs. Sherman Lee by the Clark Family in appreciation of the Lees' friendship and help over many years
inscription: on bottom of base in red: 奉修理木造大威徳明王像一躯　台座新調　昭和十二年十月　美術院 {Bushūri mokuzō Daiitoku Myōō-zō ichi mukuro, daiza shinchō, Shōwa 12-nen 10-gatsu Bijutsuin}
medium: Wood with metal, polychrome, gilding, and inlaid crystal eyes
title: Daiitoku Myōō, the Wisdom King of Awe-Inspiring Power
